007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014import java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator;
015import java.util.function.ToDoubleBiFunction; // could use this instead
016//https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/function/package-summary.html
017
018/**
019   Create a solid model of a parametric surface in space.
020<p>
021   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parametric_surface" target="_top">
022                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parametric_surface</a>
023
024   @see ParametricCurve
025*/
026public class ParametricSurface extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
027{
028   public final DoubleBinaryOperator x;
029   public final DoubleBinaryOperator y;
030   public final DoubleBinaryOperator z;
031   public final double s1;
032   public final double s2;
033   public final double t1;
034   public final double t2;
035   public final int n;
036   public final int k;
037   public final MeshType type;
038
039   /**
040      Create a graph of the function with the following formula,
041      <pre>{@code
042          f(x,z) = sin(PI*x) * sin(PI*z)
043      }</pre>
044      as a parametric surface.
045   */
046   public ParametricSurface()
047   {
048      this((s,t) -> Math.sin(Math.PI*s) * Math.sin(Math.PI*t),
049           -1.0, 1.0, -1.0, 1.0,
050            49, 49);
051   }
052
053
054   /**
055      Create a graph of a function of two variables
056      {@code y = f(x, z)} as a parametric surface with
057      the given parameter ranges in the {@code x} and
058      {@code z} directions.
059
060      @param f   function of x and z
061      @param x1  beginning value of x-parameter range
062      @param x2  ending value of x-parameter range
063      @param z1  beginning value of y-parameter range
064      @param z2  ending value of z-parameter range
065      @param n   number of mesh lines in x-range
066      @param k   number of mesh lines in y-range
067      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
068      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
069   */
070   public ParametricSurface(final DoubleBinaryOperator f,
071                            final double x1, final double x2,
072                            final double z1, final double z2,
073                            final int n, final int k)
074   {
075      this((x,z) -> x, f, (x,z) -> z, x1, x2, z1, z2, n, k);
076   }
077
078
079   /**
080      Create a graph of a function of two variables
081      {@code y = f(x, z)} as a parametric surface with
082      the given parameter ranges in the {@code x} and
083      {@code z} directions.
084
085      @param f   function of x and z
086      @param x1  beginning value of x-parameter range
087      @param x2  ending value of x-parameter range
088      @param z1  beginning value of y-parameter range
089      @param z2  ending value of z-parameter range
090      @param n   number of mesh lines in x-range
091      @param k   number of mesh lines in y-range
092      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
093      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
094      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
095   */
096   public ParametricSurface(final DoubleBinaryOperator f,
097                            final double x1, final double x2,
098                            final double z1, final double z2,
099                            final int n, final int k,
100                            final MeshType type)
101   {
102      this((x,z) -> x, f, (x,z) -> z, x1, x2, z1, z2, n, k, type);
103   }
104
105
106   /**
107      Create a parametric surface in space,
108      <pre>{@code
109         x = x(s,t)
110         y = y(s,t)
111         z = z(s,t)
112      }</pre>
113      with the parameters {@code s} and {@code t} having
114      the given parameter ranges and the given number of
115      mesh lines in each parametric direction.
116
117      @param x   component function in the x-direction
118      @param y   component function in the y-direction
119      @param z   component function in the z-direction
120      @param s1  beginning value of first parameter range
121      @param s2  ending value of first parameter range
122      @param t1  beginning value of second parameter range
123      @param t2  ending value of second parameter range
124      @param n   number of mesh lines in first range
125      @param k   number of mesh lines in second range
126      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
127      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
128   */
129   public ParametricSurface(final DoubleBinaryOperator x,
130                            final DoubleBinaryOperator y,
131                            final DoubleBinaryOperator z,
132                            final double s1, final double s2,
133                            final double t1, final double t2,
134                            final int n, final int k)
135   {
136      this(x, y, z, s1, s2, t1, t2, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
137   }
138
139
140   /**
141      Create a parametric surface in space,
142      <pre>{@code
143         x = x(s,t)
144         y = y(s,t)
145         z = z(s,t)
146      }</pre>
147      with the parameters {@code s} and {@code t} having
148      the given parameter ranges and the given number of
149      mesh lines in each parametric direction.
150
151      @param x   component function in the x-direction
152      @param y   component function in the y-direction
153      @param z   component function in the z-direction
154      @param s1  beginning value of first parameter range
155      @param s2  ending value of first parameter range
156      @param t1  beginning value of second parameter range
157      @param t2  ending value of second parameter range
158      @param n   number of mesh lines in first range
159      @param k   number of mesh lines in second range
160      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
161      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
162      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
163   */
164   public ParametricSurface(final DoubleBinaryOperator x,
165                            final DoubleBinaryOperator y,
166                            final DoubleBinaryOperator z,
167                            final double s1, final double s2,
168                            final double t1, final double t2,
169                            final int n, final int k,
170                            final MeshType type)
171   {
172      this(x, y, z, s1, s2, t1, t2, n, k, type,
173          String.format("Parametric Surface(%d,%d)", n, k));
174   }
175
176
177   /**
178      Create a parametric surface in space,
179      <pre>{@code
180         x = x(s,t)
181         y = y(s,t)
182         z = z(s,t)
183      }</pre>
184      with the parameters {@code s} and {@code t} having
185      the given parameter ranges and the given number of
186      mesh lines in each parametric direction.
187
188      @param x   component function in the x-direction
189      @param y   component function in the y-direction
190      @param z   component function in the z-direction
191      @param s1  beginning value of first parameter range
192      @param s2  ending value of first parameter range
193      @param t1  beginning value of second parameter range
194      @param t2  ending value of second parameter range
195      @param n   number of mesh lines in first range
196      @param k   number of mesh lines in second range
197      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
198      @param name  {@link String} name for this surface
199      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
200      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
201   */
202   public ParametricSurface(final DoubleBinaryOperator x,
203                            final DoubleBinaryOperator y,
204                            final DoubleBinaryOperator z,
205                            final double s1, final double s2,
206                            final double t1, final double t2,
207                            final int n, final int k,
208                            final MeshType type,
209                            String name)
210   {
211      super(name);
212
213      if (n < 2)
214         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 1");
215      if (k < 2)
216         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 1");
217
218      this.x = x;
219      this.y = y;
220      this.z = z;
221      this.s1 = s1;
222      this.s2 = s2;
223      this.t1 = t1;
224      this.t2 = t2;
225      this.n = n;
226      this.k = k;
227      this.type = type;
228
229      // Create the surface's geometry.
230
231      final double deltaS = (s2 - s1) / (n - 1), // lines of latitude (dy)
232                   deltaT = (t2 - t1) / (k - 1); // lines of longitude (dx)
233
234      // An array of vertices to be used to create the triangles.
235      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
236
237      // Create all the vertices.
238      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a line of latitude
239      {
240         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
241         {
242            v[i][j] = new Vertex(x.applyAsDouble(s1 + i*deltaS, t1 + j*deltaT),
243                                 y.applyAsDouble(s1 + i*deltaS, t1 + j*deltaT),
244                                 z.applyAsDouble(s1 + i*deltaS, t1 + j*deltaT));
245         }
246      }
247
248      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
249      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
250      {
251         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
252         {
253            addVertex( v[i][j] );
254         }
255      }
256
257      // Create the triangle strips.
258      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
259      {
260         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
261         {
262            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
263            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
264            {
265               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j);  // v[i  ][j]
266               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j);  // v[i+1][j]
267            }
268            addPrimitive(triStrip);
269         }
270      }
271      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
272      {
273         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j)
274         {
275            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
276            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
277            {
278               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j + 1);  // v[i][j+1]
279               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j);      // v[i][j  ]
280            }
281            addPrimitive(triStrip);
282         }
283      }
284      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
285      {
286         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
287         {
288            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j)
289            {
290               addPrimitive(
291                  new TriangleStrip(   i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
292                                    (1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
293                                       i * k + j + 1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
294                                    (1+i)* k + j + 1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
295            }
296         }
297      }
298   }
299
300
301
302   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
303   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
304
305   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
306
307   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
308
309   @Override
310   public ParametricSurface remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
311   {
312      return new ParametricSurface(this.x, this.y, this.z,
313                             this.s1, this.s2,
314                             this.t1, this.t2,
315                             n, k,
316                             type);
317   }
318}//ParametricSurface
